subject: Communication
title: The Curiosity Gap
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Curiosity Gap.

hook.text: 'You won't believe what happened next.' You hate clickbait, but you clicked anyway. That's the curiosity gap.

buildup.text: George Loewenstein's information gap theory: curiosity arises when we perceive a gap between what we know and want to.

discovery.text: Stories create deliberate gaps â€” unanswered questions that pull the audience forward to find out what happens.

twist.text: Too small a gap: boring. Too large a gap: confusing. The sweet spot is 'I almost know, but not quite.'

climax.text: Every great opening line creates a curiosity gap: 'Call me Ishmael' â€” who is this person? Why?

punchline.text: The best stories don't give answers. They make you need them.

quiz.question: Who developed the information gap theory of curiosity?
